byline.original: By GUIDO ENDERIS Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Germany: censorship of foreign news, broadcasts and films complete; neutral papers barred
snippet: BERLIN, Dec. 31--London and Paris are about three hours distant from Berlin by air, but since the proclamation of a "state of war" the populace of Berlin might as well attempt to establish communication with the Martians as to try to find out what...

headline.main: REICH IS ENFORCING ITS BAN UPON NEWS; 'Radio Discipline' Is Latest Slogan--Listening to Any Foreigners Punished NEUTRAL PAPERS BARRED Strict Domestic Censorship Is Defended as a Matter of Patriotic Policy

lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Dec. 31--London and Paris are about three hours distant from Berlin by air, but since the proclamation of a "state of war" the populace of Berlin might as well attempt to establish communication with the Martians as to try to find out what is going on in those cities.
